cosmo_cli.cosmo_cli.init_logger()[source]¶

initializes a logger to be used throughout the cli can be used by provider codes.

Return type:tupel with 2 loggers, one for users (writes to console and file), and the other for archiving (writes to file only).
cosmo_cli.cosmo_cli.main()[source]¶
cosmo_cli.cosmo_cli.set_global_verbosity_level(is_verbose_output=False)[source]¶

sets the global verbosity level for console and the lgr logger.

Parameters:is_verbose_output (bool) – should be output be verbose
Return type:None
cosmo_cli.cosmo_cli.init(provider, target_directory, reset_config, install=False, creds=None, is_verbose_output=False)[source]¶

iniatializes a provider by copying its config files to the cwd. First, will look for a module named cloudify_#provider#. If not found, will look for #provider#. If install is True, will install the supplied provider and perform the search again.

Parameters:
  • provider (string) – the provider’s name
  • target_directory (string) – target directory for the config files
  • reset_config (bool) – if True, overrides the current config.
  • install (bool) – if supplied, will also install the desired provider according to the given url or module name (pypi).
  • creds – a comma separated key=value list of credential info. this is specific to each provider.
  • is_verbose_output (bool) – if True, output will be verbose.
Return type:

string representing the provider’s module name

class cosmo_cli.provider_common.BaseProviderClass(provider_config=None, is_verbose_output=False, schema=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

this is the basic provider class supplied with the CLI. it can be imported
by the provider’s code by inheritence into the ProviderManager class. each of the below methods can be overriden in favor of a different impl.
provision()[source]¶

provisions resources for the management server

validate(validation_errors={})[source]¶

validations to be performed before provisioning and bootstrapping the management server.

Parameters:validation_errors (dict) – dict to hold all validation errors.
Return type:dict of validaiton_errors.
teardown(provider_context, ignore_validation=False)[source]¶

tears down the management server and its accompanied provisioned resources

bootstrap(mgmt_ip, private_ip, mgmt_ssh_key, mgmt_ssh_user, dev_mode=False)[source]¶

bootstraps Cloudify on the management server.

Parameters:
  • mgmt_ip (string) – public ip of the provisioned instance.
  • private_ip (string) – private ip of the provisioned instance. (for configuration purposes).
  • mgmt_ssh_key (string) – path to the ssh key to be used for connecting to the instance.
  • mgmt_ssh_user (string) – the user to use when connecting to the instance.
  • dev_mode (bool) – states whether dev_mode should be applied.
Return type:

bool True if succeeded, False otherwise. If False is returned and ‘cfy bootstrap’ was executed with the keep-up-on-failure flag, the provisioned resources will remain. If the flag is ommited, they will be torn down.
validate_schema(validation_errors={}, schema=None)[source]¶

this is a basic implementation of schema validation. uses the Draft4Validator from jsonschema to validate the provider’s config. a schema file must be created and its contents supplied when initializing the ProviderManager class using the schema parameter.

Parameters:
  • validation_errors (dict) – dict to hold all validation errors.
  • schema (dict) – a schema to compare the provider’s config to. the provider’s config is already initialized within the ProviderManager class in the provider’s code.
Return type:

dict of validation_errors.
